part.Name: Description
part.Short: This airy robe was once woven from fine cloth... now, stained by the timeless depravities of sin...

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Though different sects may sport different insignia, all robes are covered in the mildew of the morning boomrose, so as to ward off evil spirits.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The owner of these robes attained a high rank within the seekers' fellowship, as indicated by the golden star pins running down the shoulders. The quality is exceptional, soft to the touch and yet resistant to external traumas.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: It glimmers and shimmers on all planes, visible to the mundane and otherworldly alike; so much so in fact that the magics contained therein spring forth, causing lesser beings to flee in fright. The seekers believe the robes to have been blessed by Ptoh.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: This simple tunic was woven of stiff plant fiber, then hardened by the baking sun. It smells of the meadows.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Years of exposure to the all-mother in the sky have imbued this simple tunic with an undying shine. It smells of the meadows, She says.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Enforcers of olde would wear these during tumultuous times. A safety bubble in a lake of madness.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A large, circular shield, made of tin and copper.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Crafted and imbued with invigorating elements in such a fashion that only a skilled crone could weave.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: &R[WARNING: Not yet fully implemented] &yAn unsightly chrome bulge hangs from your frame, like a balloon awaiting a needle to absolve it of sin and pain.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Pearl-bound sandals aren't the only piece of craftsmanship the river-wives are known for. Vibrant, fiery masks covered in autumn leaves are worn in nigh every celebration. It is stitched to a long stick so that it may be held with one hand

part.Name: Description
part.Short: This kilt was skillfully fletched using the metallic feathers of a coal-black swan.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The crystalline skin of the koi was flayed off and applied to a soft rubberseed interior. Were it not for this added layer, the wearer would surely impale themselves on the koi's sharp scales.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Flowers align this decorative shield. The base is made of precious hardwood, which was drenched in woodworm toxins and tree sap, then left to oxidise over time.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Tangled mudroot was further entangled by some form of organised chaos into a useable shield.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Shaped like the crescent moon, this piece is surprisingly wieldy. The hillside natives are to be thanked for its existence.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Carved out of the petrified flesh of a wandering cherub, amongst the first to walk the Earth. Its very existence born from an unforgiveable crime - its wearer will likewise be judged and persecuted by the faithful.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A short, wooden shaft topped with a wicked curved blade. Used to harvest wheat and other edibles. A potentially dangerous weapon in skilled hands.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A short, wooden shaft topped with a wicked curved blade. Used to harvest wheat and other edibles. A potentially dangerous weapon in skilled hands.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A long, flexible shaft topped with a wicked curved blade. Used to flay the tough watervine hides. Requires two hands, lest one wishes to maim oneself.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A long, flexible shaft topped with a wicked curved blade. Used to flay the tough watervine hides. Requires two hands, lest one wishes to maim oneself.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A hulking blade, the claymore is a massively popular weapon in the far west. It hungers for the flesh of giants.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A hulking blade, the claymore is a massively popular weapon in the far west. It hungers for the flesh of chrome giants.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A hulking blade, the claymore is a massively popular weapon in the far west. It hungers for the flesh of chrome giants.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: In Qud's deepest cracks, where even the long arm of justice may not reach, death's arm, shapeless and ever-growing, stretches out to strangle the breath of life out of all beings equally, without forethought or prejudice.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A farmhand's best friend, or so it would be were it not for dogs. Three sharp points stand ready to impale the target.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A sleek metal shaft dotted with electroglands on one end.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A gleaming blade of foreign origins. Or rather, foreign to you - not to this world. Indeed, it does not take long for it to dawn on you that you are the foreigner here. The hilt's purple wrappings are as soft as a calves' thighs, but you feel wrong holding it, perhaps realising this blade wasn't meant for you.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Great stretches of sun-bleached azure embrace the remnants of a once great city. An intricate web of desolate chrome towers caress the sky.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Contrary to popular belief, the walls of this solemn place have not been, in fact, reworked into folded carbide. Rather, they had originally been made using its much darker forefather and namesake, carbide. Over millenia, the sun has sapped all life out of its hue; where there were once glistening veins, there lie now empty cracks.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Black and yellow stripes run along the walls, reminiscent of a hornet's nest.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Timeless concrete was poured in methodical fashion, then washed in a nauseating sea of orange.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A mimicry - an imitation - une fausse etoile.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A slender spine bathed in chrome.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The craftsmanship and ingenuity of a thousand years encapsulated in a singular ageless shape.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Countless shrines and depictions such as this one litter and permeate Qud. Chloris is most popular among the Screaming Men; the biannual Dromad's Qud Chronicles on fitness and wellbeing rank Her as second most popular deity in this area. Her hair was made to match the motion of the wind's many tantrums.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A pair of legs twice your height carry the wordless beauty above it with immaculate precision and balance. You feel a strange sense of embarrassment staring at this part for too long; perhaps you ought to adjust your gaze upward?

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A sturdy crate. The scent of plastic is nauseating.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The buzz of the lights is overshadowed by nearby commotion.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: You really have no idea what this does. A waste of space if you've ever seen one.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The empty husk of a drilling tick.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: These dice are used by folk of all ages to play simple games of chance. They can be attached to one's wrist, begifting the favour of Lady Luck. A minuscule inscription reads: 'Midnight Paradice'

part.Name: Description
part.Short: It is inscribed with the wisdom of a nameless hermit: 'Lest others hate thee, supposed absence of intimate affection does not result in proof of absence thereof. Forget not; what is most important is merely to love thyself.'

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
Moonlit streets. Roaring engines. Neon lights.
Activating the contraption reveals the following inscription in digital form: 'Ride or die baby.'

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A long, damp and sticky thread of mintlace that has undergone secondary fermentation.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The bittersweet threads of the mintlace tree were mashed, set over an open flame, left out to cool, and jarred for later use. The smell embodies the thriving yet vicious nature of the hills and marshes.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Its entire being unwinds in the palm of your hand, a foreshow to its imminent demise.

part.Name: Food
part.Message: Yuck! The taste is sure to linger a little while longer

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The children of the new age have come up with their own playful taunts, adding some much-needed childlike reprieve to a world harsh beyond measure. For these berries, the rhyme goes: 'Bitter-batter, bitter-batter, Igrette ate it, ate the latter!'

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A glint of light in a desolate world; a sister moon.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A glint of light in a desolate world; the remedy to a famished belly.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The purple-blue hue envelops your mind, turning your third eye to an imaginary realm of opulence and debauchery.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Soft yet resilient; matte yet glistening; vicious yet beautiful.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A strange, glowing tube. It shines the same light as the stars above. Sporadically, it shakes and quivers in your bag.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Golden-wet ivy leaves entangle your mind as you peer into its shining recesses. The dream never ends.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: With every move you fear the flower may fall apart, like sand between your palms.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The mingo fits in your hand like a glowsphere, and though it isn't luminescent the splendid colours do brighten your day.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The essence of mingo is known to have countless unforeseen effects when ingested, this being likely due to the nature of the mimingo as it imitates its environment for the sake of survival. Most often though it merely has a reinvigorating effect on the eater.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A series of colourful, explosive images; wild movements and flashy poses, all coupled with strange symbols strewn across the pages. A vibrant mess.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: [...] with wars having been fought over the course of centuries for this prized flower. Tomes dating to the pre-Sultanate era recall the tales of the Power Nine, a group of legendary warriors [...] and craftsmen, whose founding purpose was to retrieve and [contain] the powers imbued within The Black Lotus. Though these historic tomes were lost not long ago, their existence was confirmed by the magi of the azure city, whose records detail their retrieval and eventual loss to the Emerald Kings. [...] Scholars and merchants of the present day doubt the very existence of this flower, citing the tomes as nothing more than 'folklore and faerie tales'...

part.Name: Description
part.Short: In the deepest, darkest gorges of Qud is where the Everspring Emerald is formed. Over millenia, it seeps the energies of the Mother Oak, whose roots stretch into and across land's end. The powers within this emerald possess enough force to revitalise an entire quadrant of desolate land - and keep it in a blossoming state until the crystal is sapped of all power, or time itself ceases to flow - whichever comes first. Considering its rarity, geologists estimate the total count of the emerald to range from ten to a hundred at most.

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
'If Heaven has placed it in your hands, it means that the throne is destined to be yours.'
- The Founding Chronicles, Tome II

xtagTextFragments.Activity: droning for the flock,burrowing into the earth,rummaging through petals
xtagTextFragments.NeedsItemFor: for my own collection,to slake my greed,because of its trade value,for my eyes
xtagTextFragments.SacredThing: chirping by the light of the Beetle Moon,xenophagy,hexapoda,larvae,chitin,the protection of an exoskeleton

part.Name: Description
part.Short: =pronouns.IndicativeProximal= vigilant, hearty =pronouns.personTerm= =verb:wear:afterpronoun= a white apron stained with the scent of mintlace threads. =pronouns.Possessive= sharp eyes pierce through the browned skin of =pronouns.possessive= tired face. From =pronouns.possessive= right forearm hangs a wet rag, with which =pronouns.subjective= =verb:scrub:afterpronoun= the dirt from =pronouns.possessive= hands every few moments.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: That's a dead fox.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ...tenses, before springing forth with explosive elasticity onto its prey. It must keep its young fed.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: This tiny furball uses its pointy ears and a keen sense of smell to spot prey in the vast emptiness of the desert. Over generations its coat has been painted and stained in the dizzying gravel-white of the salt pans.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ...Her gaze embraces you through the auburn mist of its eyes. At last, you feel... tranquil.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: An aura of mystery surrounds this crone, her eyes gazing blankly at her diligent fingers whilst her mind drowns in a river of thoughts. Her goals are well beyond your comprehension.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Blue is a colour oft associated with anxiety, sadness or melancholy - some feel a great emptiness within them, as for others, memories of a drowning child resurface. A blue faerie is never a good omen.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The pink faerie is a joyous, vivid being. It buzzes about without a care for the happenings around it, living in a perpetual state of blissful ignorance.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The youngest of these gorgeous four-winged spirits are like clay waiting to be moulded; their wings bear no marks of ancestry, and their essence is of a pallid nature.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A vessel of pride. Its feathers are unbending.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: As black as fullerite, =pronouns.subjective= flexes =pronouns.possessive= wings in a display of dominance. In this lake, =pronouns.subjective= is the apex predator.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: River nymphs are shy, craven creatures. Under cover of the beetle moon they commit to their ritualistic dances, spreading seed and sap to all four corners of Qud. They bear oddly humanoid features, despite evidence to the contrary.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A small, humming sphere, crawling on four legs as it grazes the landscape in search of minerals.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ...then, there are the shepherds, who oversee the great flocks of nanite ticks grazing the soil and rock. Though of a lesser caste, they play just as vital a role as the socialites within the collective.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Whereas the shepherds oversee the ticks, it is the socialites who oversee the shepherds. Possessing the newest in digimind technology [warning: root OOD], they are believed to possess the most rational of thought processeses, and thus for the collective their word is law.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The prev.gen androids, as their name implies, are obsolete models, discontinued by the assemblies of the collective. Over the decades, their specialised carbide plating and circuitry become an increasingly rare find, effectively making repairs nigh impossible. Stumbling about half-conscious, these tree-hives of entangled copper contribute little to the collective.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: As with any successful colony, there are workers who toil day in and day out. This series of android forms the backbone of the collective's production capacity and workforce.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Any developed civilisation relies on tools for their continued survival, be they pitchforks, telepathy, or nimble toes. For the androids, the mechanites are their tool for war. Though they possess only a rudimentary form of intelligence, the mechanites are more than capable of shredding entities marked as [hostile] by their overseers. This model sports twin-linked wheels on both of its lower appendages, allowing it to scoot across the battlefield at high speeds.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A minor glitch in this older model has spiraled out of control, causing a multi-threaded corruption of the kernel. Of course, as the skies would have it, its sensors now mark every living thing within range and beyond as [hostile]. The frame itself sports twin-linked wheels on both of its lower appendages, allowing it to scoot across the battlefield at high speeds.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A minor glitch in this older model has spiraled out of control, causing a multi-threaded corruption of the kernel. Of course, as the skies would have it, its sensors now mark every living thing within range and beyond as [hostile]. 'GEN.6' was spray-painted in big, yellow letters on its frame.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The moment you notice its hulking frame approach in your direction, every fibre in your body instinctively tells you to run. For once, your instict is right on the drams; most cannot imagine beating this adversary, let alone outrunning its rockets.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Up and down the river it swims, up and down, always going against the tide in hopes of avoiding the hungering madpoles...

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ...though its wet belly is softer than that of its sunkissed counterpart, the moonkoi is a far rarer find, and its scales are all-the-more desired.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Violence has sapped all value out of this fish, its shattered scales now worthless.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The bloated koi rapidly depreciates; the time for harvest is now.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The apex of fashion, this progenitor of the city stands upright, displaying a deep sense of decorum. =pronouns.Subjective= =verb:wear:afterpronoun= =pronouns.possessive= finest and wields an ego vanity itself would covet. =pronouns.Subjective= competes with =pronouns.possessive= contemporaries in a bustling, ever-changing environment.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: [...] [in] the dirt-brown rubble, a gleaming penny. Around the penny, a mud-caked hand - indeed, a child, hiding in plain sight, who's outlines melt into the rock and soil of bygone ages. [...] Playfully reflecting the penny's gleam at passerby, out of boredom moreso than malice...

part.Name: Description
part.Short: This dog appears to be quite well fed. Its amber coat is the result of generations of selective breeding; such an eye-catching fur would serve no purpose in the wild.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The Urman is a being older than memory. Using ripples in time and approaching its prey from odd angles, it shadows itself, fragmenting the continuum over and over and over again.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: They say it is the root cause of all change, and of all things. But if it truly were so, then what came before it?

part.Name: Description
part.Short: These unsightly creatures come in many forms; mounds of flesh, boneless men crawling on fours, or streaks of shade bordering the ethereal realms. The origins of the replicants has long since been lost to the winds of time. Their minds, much like their bodies, are coated in the powers of entropy.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A baseline kernishi.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Kernishi, urban slang for 'glutton', are semi-animate, semi-sentient beings. Much like a medusa, they possess only the most basic of instincts, and no instinct is known to be more dangerous than that of a hungry kernishi.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: There is much debate as to whether kernishi are individuals that choose to operate in tightly-knit packs, hunting colonies of sorts, or whether the colony as a whole is an individual, compromised of several member bodies under the control of one hivemind.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A tall, lanky frame pours out of the shadows; though it appears to stumble moreso than walk. Despite this, it jolts and bolts across great distances, at times parctically falling on fours as it rushes to its prey in a frenzy. In place of forearms, two chitinous blades sprawl forth in a menacing manner, covered in the remains of its last meal.

tag.Name: PetResponse
tag.Value: beams in delight,comes a little too close for comfort,buzzes

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Fiery blue light engulfs your peripheral vision. Phelicia is never far.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Chitinous plates protect his tender heart, and with a gaze of wonder he peers at the moon. Despite their appearance giant centipedes are considered sacred by some; they are seen as harbingers of fertility and rebirth.

tag.Name: PetResponse
tag.Value: does a little dance of joy,gazes at the moon,entangles your arm

part.Name: Description
part.Short: D-12's LEDs flash a white-pink, and though they convey no emotion, you can tell there is love in its eyes.

tag.Name: PetResponse
tag.Value: does a little dance of joy,ticks,recounts one of its many stories

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A distant, pensive look coupled with a warm embrace. September stands ready to roll the dice of fate once more.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A kind, loving being, October wishes for nothing more than peace and prosperity. Ventilation exhausts peer out of her head, haphazardly blowing out steam as her processors attempt to solve the unsolveable.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The ring of tiny bells clipped to his headwear echoes through the Amphitheatre. A tall, lanky frame towers over you, and a cold, condescending look meets your eyes as you as you approach. You are not welcome here.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Ol' Pyre is known around these parts as being one of the best of his craft. Though he is a pariah to his people, few would dare say ill of him.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A timid figure, this snapjaw's fingers are tinted a spring green. Her pouch is filled to the brim with herbs and flowers of all colours and variants. Periodically she takes a seat and peeks inside the workshop whilst organising her crop.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: You feel Meribelle's golden eyes pierce right through you like a hot knife through butter. What others are oblivious to, she sees.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A short, angry man, Konkomorus is a self-described 'passionate' preacher of the 'true faith'. His arms flail wildly, gesturing to the people of the city, paired with grandiose statements regarding the state of the world.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Halfway through applying a crude mixture of camouflage, this man dons a mossy suit and a red bandana. It isn't hard to tell he isn't from around here; as with you, his missteps have echoed through the annals of time, landing himself a place here, in this hell of verdant greenery.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Long, viscous threads of hair hang down its bark, the cold morning breeze no match for its temper. The tree obscures vision - an eye for an eye, it is sure to make the world blind.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Two large stems intertwine and elope in a majestic display of Junoesque beauty. The twin lies of love and justice are born. The only justice one may find in this life, however, is the explosive crescendo of its fiery petals.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: 'twas on the fifth day that Chloris left her children, shedding heavenly tears, blessing the earth one final time.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Named after the bitter regret one's mouth may taste after ingestion of its acrid berries. They are, however, a key ingredient to many wines and tinctures.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A gentle, eye-catching flower, the Fleur de Lys is prized not only for its beauty but for its purple-blue dye. Sultans and royals from lands beyond memory paint their regalia in its splendid colour.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: It undulates in synchrony with the gushes of wind around it. It stands tall in perfect symmetry. It has a new home.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: You let out a silent shriek at first sight of this unsighlty being. It writhes about as you approach, and for a split second, you mistake it for a mimic. It would appear even the mimic has a mimic.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: The dreamweaver is as beautiful as it is mesmerising. It is said gazing into one may restore peace of mind, instilling dreams so that one's thoughts may rest.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ...that such a delicate flower could possibly thrive in any environment has for centuries baffled the Platomagi. Its habitat requirements make it all the more rare; only in the cool, dry and metallic air of Andromimos' skyscrapers is this silvery flower willing to grow.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Thin, leathery vines hang from the ceiling, obstructing vision. Sounds eminate from deep within; you are not alone here.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Not much is there to be said of the grimshoot. It is as remarkable as it is useful.

object.Name: High Dervish of the Sightless Way
Arch Dervish of the Sightless Way

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
Lucent skin blooms beneath matted feathers. =pronouns.Possessive= tiny beak is hooked.
&mphosphorescent&y

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
A disc of leaf with luminous veins.
&mphosphorescent&y

part.Name: Description
part.Short:
Luminescent flecks flit beneath the water's surface.
&mphosphorescent&y
